blog.name: ao3feed-shouji
blog.title: Shouji Mezou
blog.description: An automatic feed of fics for Shouji Mezou from My Hero Academia posted on Archive of Our Own. If there's an issue or if you have any questions, let me know! (For those on mobile, search "tags" to see the taglist!)

title: Midoriya Izuku's Gambit
description:
by Outcasts_Anonymous

Bakugou had always taken pride in his Quirk; being praised for its power; being revered by his classmates and teachers alike for his potential to become a great hero… So imagine the surprise and the rage that came with knowing that Deku; that shitty Deku, had beaten him with a pack of playing cards and a few pennies.

Words: 1037, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, M/M, Multi
  • Characters: Midoriya Izuku, Todoroki Shouto, Bakugou Katsuki, Kirishima Eijirou, Iida Tenya, Yagi Toshinori | All Might, Kaminari Denki, Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead, Ashido Mina, Asui Tsuyu, Jirou Kyouka, Midoriya Inko, Shinsou Hitoshi, Tokoyami Fumikage, Shouji Mezou
  • Additional Tags: X-Men References, BAMF Midoriya Izuku, Bisexual Midoriya Izuku, Midoriya Izuku Has a Quirk, Midoriya Izuku Does Not Have One for All Quirk, Sassy Midoriya Izuku, Todoroki Enji | Endeavor’s Bad Parenting, Other Additional Tags to Be Added, Tags Are Hard

tags: was he just crying all day?
summary: you know, I’m probably taking in waaaay too much from what was probably a quickly done stock image by underpaid animators, but...
body:
you know, I’m probably taking in waaaay too much from what was probably a quickly done stock image by underpaid animators, but now that you mention it…

This is supposed to be Day 1, isn’t it? They just moved in. Everything is supposed to be brand new, not counting furniture hauled in from their parents’ homes, because who brings in a half empty tissue box to a new place?

But, yeah, that tissue box is empty. The garbage is also empty I thiinnk? Looks empty-ish? 

Also he owns ONE comb?

And there is NOTHING on that drawertop with the single tiny screen shoved in the corner, like…

???

… Ojiro what is happening?? Everyone spent the day setting up their rooms, you had nothing TO set up essentially, did you just.. Spend all day crying?? I HAVE QUESTIONS.

summary: Late Night Stealth Practice - CrzA - 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia [Archive of Our Own]
title: Late Night Stealth Practice - CrzA - 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Shouto wakes to three steady knocks on the door to the veranda, squinting at the closed curtains as if they have committed a grave offense while he decides whether he actually heard it or if it’s just the remnants of a dream he no longer recalls.

Shouto is woken up by his best friend in order to sneak out for some late night fun.

One more entry for @365daysoftododeku that was posted a few days ago! Just a short and sweet drabble ^-^

summary: Part 3 of Getsui Mogenei Fantasy AU [BNHA OC]
title: Part 3 of Getsui Mogenei Fantasy AU [BNHA OC]
body:
“What is-” before Midoriya could finish his question, Getsui ripped her sleeve down to cover the marking and got back up, holding her burning arm.

“Hey! ANSWER US! WHAT THE HECK WAS THAT?!” Bakugou yelled again, unnerved by everything he had witnessed. Getsui breathed heavily and was dizzy from the pain, but she stumbled forward, intending to return to camp.

“Listen Katsuki, Izuku. There’s something coming. Something big, and bad. Death didn’t tell me much else, but we have to get ready,” she paused and turned around to face them, “we’re the only ones who can stop the incoming evil.”

Bakugou and Midoriya looked at each other, and looked back, only to find Getsui already heading back towards the camp. Midoriya jogged after her, and after one last scornful glance at the town, Bakugou followed as well.

“Wait, Mogenei, you said you met Death?”

“The fuck is up with your hair? It looks crappy.”

Getsui slowed her steps until stopping completely. She stared at her forearm then looked back up at the boys. “Can we please… not talk about it? Just for now… I promise I’ll explain later. Just, please, not right now?” Her voice was small, hinting at her own confusion and fear at what she had just committed. They both stared at the undead witch, and then the village boy turned to look pleadingly at the violent barbarian.

“Tch, whatever.” Getsui sighed a ‘thank you’ and continued following behind them while staring at a point in space next to her.

“Not now.”

Bakugou turned back to Getsui and told her, “We know, we get it!” annoyance evident in his voice.

Mogenei turned to look at him with a face of confusion which quickly changed with some kind of realization. “Oh! Sorry, wasn’t talking to you guys.” Izuku and Katsuki looked at her strangely and she quickly corrected herself, “I mean- uhm, you know what, nevermind!” She stared at the ground in embarrassment and shot another glance at the point in space she was so intently watching.

“Did that stupid lizard finish hunting yet?” Katsuki thought aloud as they walked along the trail. Mogenei snapped out of her transfixion with the empty space and looked back at the two boys as the barbarian whistled loudly for his comrade. “Grr… he better get here fast. I’m fucking tired of walking.”

“Aw, does the princess’s wittle fweet huwrt?” Getsui teased.

“SHUT UP GHOST GIRL!”

Getsui turned her head to the empty space beside her and laughed at it. “Don’t worry your highness, I’ll carry you.” Before Katsuki could reply, Mogenei cast a spell and lifted the impatient blond into the air.

“THE HELL?! PUT ME DOWN!” Bakugou yelled.

Getsui smirked at his struggle to get down. “You said you were tired of walking, right?” Bakugou screeched and threatened to kill her and she wittily replied, “Eh, wouldn’t be my first time.” That shut him up. Midoriya and Bakugou were both mortified by the sight of watching Getsui hang by her neck. It certainly wasn’t something they’d forget easily. Yet here she was, walking, talking, breathing, with white hair now, and messing around as if everything was normal. She even cracked a joke about it.

She looked between the two and realized her mistake. “Oh… sorry, too soon, right?” Katsuki made a sound of disapproval, and Izuku slowly nodded. Mogenei mumbled a lame apology. An awkward silence was about to settle when the sound of distant yells was heard in the direction they were heading.

“Look! They’re over there!” Kirishima Eijirou began to descend with Knight Iida Tenya on his back. Kirishima was a dragon halfling, being able to alternate between human and dragon forms. In his dragon form, he landed a couple of meters in from of them, and Izuku rushed up to greet them. Katsuki landed with a thud upon being released from Mogenei’s spell, the witch herself walking over the group.

“Getsui! Are you alright? What happened to your hair?!” Iida asked hurriedly while chopping the air with his arm.

All eyes were on her, expecting her answer. Mogenei chuckled uncomfortably under the scrutiny of their stares. “Ahaa… uh… magic?” She held her hands up and wiggled her fingers, hoping they wouldn’t interrogate her further.

“It looks cool,” Kirishima, now in human form, complimented with a smile.

“O-oh. Thanks…” Mogenei, fortunately, did know about a potion that could alter hair color, but it was temporary and faded with time. Still, it was something, for now.

“Tch, whatever.” Getsui sighed a ‘thank you’ and continued following behind them while staring at a point in space next to her.

“Not now.”

Bakugou turned back to Getsui and told her, “We know, we get it!” annoyance evident in his voice.

Mogenei turned to look at him with a face of confusion which quickly changed with some kind of realization. “Oh! Sorry, wasn’t talking to you guys.” Izuku and Katsuki looked at her strangely and she quickly corrected herself, “I mean- uhm, you know what, nevermind!” She stared at the ground in embarrassment and shot another glance at the point in space she was so intently watching.

“Did that stupid lizard finish hunting yet?” Katsuki thought aloud as they walked along the trail. Mogenei snapped out of her transfixion with the empty space and looked back at the two boys as the barbarian whistled loudly for his comrade. “Grr… he better get here fast. I’m fucking tired of walking.”

“Aw, does the princess’s wittle fweet huwrt?” Getsui teased.

“SHUT UP GHOST GIRL!”

Getsui turned her head to the empty space beside her and laughed at it. “Don’t worry your highness, I’ll carry you.” Before Katsuki could reply, Mogenei cast a spell and lifted the impatient blond into the air.

“THE HELL?! PUT ME DOWN!” Bakugou yelled.

Getsui smirked at his struggle to get down. “You said you were tired of walking, right?” Bakugou screeched and threatened to kill her and she wittily replied, “Eh, wouldn’t be my first time.” That shut him up. Midoriya and Bakugou were both mortified by the sight of watching Getsui hang by her neck. It certainly wasn’t something they’d forget easily. Yet here she was, walking, talking, breathing, with white hair now, and messing around as if everything was normal. She even cracked a joke about it.

She looked between the two and realized her mistake. “Oh… sorry, too soon, right?” Katsuki made a sound of disapproval, and Izuku slowly nodded. Mogenei mumbled a lame apology. An awkward silence was about to settle when the sound of distant yells was heard in the direction they were heading.

“Look! They’re over there!” Kirishima Eijirou began to descend with Knight Iida Tenya on his back. Kirishima was a dragon halfling, being able to alternate between human and dragon forms. In his dragon form, he landed a couple of meters in from of them, and Izuku rushed up to greet them. Katsuki landed with a thud upon being released from Mogenei’s spell, the witch herself walking over the group.

“Getsui! Are you alright? What happened to your hair?!” Iida asked hurriedly while chopping the air with his arm.

All eyes were on her, expecting her answer. Mogenei chuckled uncomfortably under the scrutiny of their stares. “Ahaa… uh… magic?” She held her hands up and wiggled her fingers, hoping they wouldn’t interrogate her further.

“It looks cool,” Kirishima, now in human form, complimented with a smile.

“O-oh. Thanks…” Mogenei, fortunately, did know about a potion that could alter hair color, but it was temporary and faded with time. Still, it was something, for now.
trail.content:
“What is-” before Midoriya could finish his question, Getsui ripped her sleeve down to cover the marking and got back up, holding her burning arm.

“Hey! ANSWER US! WHAT THE HECK WAS THAT?!” Bakugou yelled again, unnerved by everything he had witnessed. Getsui breathed heavily and was dizzy from the pain, but she stumbled forward, intending to return to camp.

“Listen Katsuki, Izuku. There’s something coming. Something big, and bad. Death didn’t tell me much else, but we have to get ready,” she paused and turned around to face them, “we’re the only ones who can stop the incoming evil.”

Bakugou and Midoriya looked at each other, and looked back, only to find Getsui already heading back towards the camp. Midoriya jogged after her, and after one last scornful glance at the town, Bakugou followed as well.

“Wait, Mogenei, you said you met Death?”

“The fuck is up with your hair? It looks crappy.”

Getsui slowed her steps until stopping completely. She stared at her forearm then looked back up at the boys. “Can we please… not talk about it? Just for now… I promise I’ll explain later. Just, please, not right now?” Her voice was small, hinting at her own confusion and fear at what she had just committed. They both stared at the undead witch, and then the village boy turned to look pleadingly at the violent barbarian.

“Tch, whatever.” Getsui sighed a ‘thank you’ and continued following behind them while staring at a point in space next to her.

“Not now.”

Bakugou turned back to Getsui and told her, “We know, we get it!” annoyance evident in his voice.

Mogenei turned to look at him with a face of confusion which quickly changed with some kind of realization. “Oh! Sorry, wasn’t talking to you guys.” Izuku and Katsuki looked at her strangely and she quickly corrected herself, “I mean- uhm, you know what, nevermind!” She stared at the ground in embarrassment and shot another glance at the point in space she was so intently watching.

“Did that stupid lizard finish hunting yet?” Katsuki thought aloud as they walked along the trail. Mogenei snapped out of her transfixion with the empty space and looked back at the two boys as the barbarian whistled loudly for his comrade. “Grr… he better get here fast. I’m fucking tired of walking.”

“Aw, does the princess’s wittle fweet huwrt?” Getsui teased.

“SHUT UP GHOST GIRL!”

Getsui turned her head to the empty space beside her and laughed at it. “Don’t worry your highness, I’ll carry you.” Before Katsuki could reply, Mogenei cast a spell and lifted the impatient blond into the air.

“THE HELL?! PUT ME DOWN!” Bakugou yelled.

Getsui smirked at his struggle to get down. “You said you were tired of walking, right?” Bakugou screeched and threatened to kill her and she wittily replied, “Eh, wouldn’t be my first time.” That shut him up. Midoriya and Bakugou were both mortified by the sight of watching Getsui hang by her neck. It certainly wasn’t something they’d forget easily. Yet here she was, walking, talking, breathing, with white hair now, and messing around as if everything was normal. She even cracked a joke about it.

She looked between the two and realized her mistake. “Oh… sorry, too soon, right?” Katsuki made a sound of disapproval, and Izuku slowly nodded. Mogenei mumbled a lame apology. An awkward silence was about to settle when the sound of distant yells was heard in the direction they were heading.

“Look! They’re over there!” Kirishima Eijirou began to descend with Knight Iida Tenya on his back. Kirishima was a dragon halfling, being able to alternate between human and dragon forms. In his dragon form, he landed a couple of meters in from of them, and Izuku rushed up to greet them. Katsuki landed with a thud upon being released from Mogenei’s spell, the witch herself walking over the group.

“Getsui! Are you alright? What happened to your hair?!” Iida asked hurriedly while chopping the air with his arm.

All eyes were on her, expecting her answer. Mogenei chuckled uncomfortably under the scrutiny of their stares. “Ahaa… uh… magic?” She held her hands up and wiggled her fingers, hoping they wouldn’t interrogate her further.

“It looks cool,” Kirishima, now in human form, complimented with a smile.

“O-oh. Thanks…” Mogenei, fortunately, did know about a potion that could alter hair color, but it was temporary and faded with time. Still, it was something, for now.

summary: Kirishima: Okay, yeah, I LOVE Bakugo! I have loving feelings for Bakugo. But does that mean I am IN love with them? No-...
body:
Kirishima: Okay, yeah, I LOVE Bakugo! I have loving feelings for Bakugo. But does that mean I am IN love with them? No-

Kirishima: Oh my god. I’m in love with Bakugo.

Kirishima, to the rest of the Bakusquad: Why didn’t you guys tell me?

Mina: We thought you knew.
